What the hell is Webpack?


A module bundler


Webpack takes modules with dependencies and generates static assets representing those modules.

What the hell is Webpack?

Hmmm... Wait a minute...

I got a lot of other tools already to do that kind of stuff

  • Gulp
  • Grunt
  • Browserify
  • RequireJS
  • SytemJS
  • Insert your supposedly awesome library here

Why in the world would I need another one?

Let's try it

Entry -> Output syntax

webpack entry.js bundle.js

Use a config file and just run webpack

module.exports =
  context: paths.src
  entry:
    app: ['./index.js']
  output:
    path: paths.output
    filename: 'bundle.js'

Loaders transform the modules into static assets


Require file with loader

require('coffee!yolo.coffee')

Or add it to the config file

module.exports =
  ####
  module:
    loaders: [
      { test: /\.coffee$/, loader: 'coffee' }
      { test: /\.css$/, loader: 'style!css' }
    ]

Embracing the chaos


Different assets, different languages

Multiple ways to define modules

CommonJs


require("module");
require("../file.js");
exports.doStuff = function() {};
module.exports = someValue;

AMD


require(["module", "../file"], function(module, file) { /* ... */ });
define("mymodule", ["dep1", "dep2"], function(d1, d2) {
  return someExportedValue;
});

Good news everyone!

Webpack handles everything!


Motivation:

Give the developer the choice of the module style.
Allow existing code to work.
Make it easy to add custom module styles.

Webpack Devserver


$ webpack-dev-server --content-base www/ [--hot]

Express Server with socket.io for updates

Bundle is served from memory without being written!

-> Great Performance

The Awesomeness of Hot Module Replacement


“Hot Module Replacement” (HMR) is a feature to inject updated modules into the active runtime.

It’s like LiveReload for every module.

Hmm..., what does that mean exactly?


For instance, if you update a CSS module,
Only the CSS will be updated!!

Hot Module Replacement


Unfortunately still a Beta feature, but it's already awesome with:

  • Stylesheets
  • React (see React hot loader)

Let's try it!

Plugins


Plugins work on the entire bundle and do cool things

Easy way to modularize the configuration

Many plugins are available


  • Minification
  • Deduplication
  • ...
  • See the plugins made by Webpack

Include the plugins in your conf


module.exports =
  ####
  plugins: [
    new webpack.optimize.UglifyJsPlugin()
  ]

So many other cool things!
